audio_sermons.title: A Call To Full-Sized Christianity
audio_sermons.description: So many today want to down-size their Christian life, but we need Christians who are full-sized in: 1-faith 2-service 3-confidence.

audio_sermons.title: A Shepherd For The Multitude
audio_sermons.description: The feeding of the 5000 shows that Jesus is the caring shepherd, the feeding shepherd, and the sufficient shepherd.

audio_sermons.title: Christ As Our King
audio_sermons.description: In his kingly office, the Lord Jesus subdues sinners and sets up his throne in their hearts.

audio_sermons.title: Christ As Our Priest
audio_sermons.description: One part of Jesus' priestly work was to make atonement for the sins of His people. 1-Why do sins have to be taken out of the way for God to be at peace with sinners? 2-What did Jesus do to take our sins out of the way?

audio_sermons.title: Christ As Our Prophet
audio_sermons.description: A prophet represents God to men. As God's prophet Jesus declares to us: 1-the reality of God 2-the nature of God 3-the reality of human sin 4-the way our sins can be forgiven.

audio_sermons.title: Christian Growth
audio_sermons.description: GPS-Guidance in Practical Spirituality. Christian growth is an important part of practical Christian living. 1-The desire for growth 2-The areas of growth 3-The means of growth

audio_sermons.title: Gathered To His People
audio_sermons.description: In this account or Abraham's death we have a sparkling jewel. Abraham was "gathered to his people". 1-The sense in which Abraham was gathered to his people. 2-The way in which Abraham came to possess this great blessing.

audio_sermons.title: Satisfied To Do Little When We Should Be Doing Much
audio_sermons.description: Elisha is on his deathbed when he receives a visit from King Joash, who seeks Elisha's counsel concerning the dilemma he is in. Elisha gives Joash a test which he fails because he was satisfied to do little when he should have done much. 1-The good cause 2-The sufficient resources 3-The missing element

audio_sermons.title: Shepherding God's Flock
audio_sermons.description: This account of Paul's farewell to the Ephesian elders is powerful and riveting. Paul knew that this would be his last meeting with these elders whom he had come to love during his long ministry in Ephesus. We see here: 1-the shepherd 2-the shepherd's flock.

audio_sermons.title: Spiritual Readiness
audio_sermons.description: In this passage we see the apostle Paul's readiness to preach the gospel anywhere and his readiness to die for Christ. How do we explain Paul's spiritual readiness? 1-He was guided by the Spirit. 2-He was motivated by love for Christ. 3-He was fortified by the fellowship of other believers.

audio_sermons.title: The Capstone Set To The Cries Of "Grace! Grace!"
audio_sermons.description: Three lines drawn from this passage to our own day: 1-A line from the ruins of Solomon's temple to a far greater ruin 2-A line from that Zerubbabel to a far greater Zerubbabel 3-A line from that capstone to a far greater capstone. Just as the capstone of the rebuilt temple was put in place to the cries of "grace, grace", so the capstone of redemption will one day be put in place, and the cry of the glorified church will be, "Grace! Grace!".

audio_sermons.title: The Challenge To The Church In Chilling Times
audio_sermons.description: 1-It is crucial for believers to have hearts for God and his work. 2-It is crucial for believers to count the cost and be willing to pay the price for having hearts for God. 3-It is crucial that believers be great believers and great prayers.

audio_sermons.title: The Power Of The Gospel And The Poison Of The Devil
audio_sermons.description: 1-The power of the Gospel 2-The poison of the devil

audio_sermons.title: The Tower Builders And The Name Game
audio_sermons.description: The tower of Babel: 1-The context of this story 2-The character of this tower 3-The curse of Babel

audio_sermons.title: The University Of The Burning Bush
audio_sermons.description: Moses was trained in Pharaoh's university in all the wisdom Egypt had to offer. But at the burning bush Moses is enrolled in God's university and learns important truths about God, about the people of God, and about the Christ of God.

audio_sermons.title: The Ups And Downs Of Faith
audio_sermons.description: As Christians, walking the life of faith, we have ups and downs in our faith and can learn lessons from Abraham's experiences. 1-Abraham succeeding in his faith 2-Abraham falling in his faith 3-Abraham being renewed in his faith
